intro: Lessingia ramulosa var. tenuis, commonly known as the slenderlessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress species. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It has a low-growing habit and is often found in coastal and inland desert regions. The variety tenuis is distinguished by its more slender stems and leaves compared to the typical form of Lessingia ramulosa.
